iati-activity.title: SUSTAINABLE FORESTRY PROJECT

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Community Encouragement Programme in Savannakhet Province. The Community Encouragement Programme (CEP) seeks to establish successful community development programmes in 16 villages in the Songkhone district and to expand them into the urban area of the Savannakhet town. The idea is to encourage and train the local communities to take charge of their own development. The programme that was started in 1998 is now moving towards more concentration on the growing urban centre_ Savannakhet. The programme was recently evaluated by the Laosian authorities as one of the best CEP programmes in the country. Fida cooperates with several local authorities and goverment offices. Through the programme the village communities have received capacity-building on preventive health care_ agriculture and micro-enterprise formation. Now_ as the focus is moving more towards the urban poor_ there will be more concentration on micro-enterprise activities. As the local peopleâs â whether in rural or urban surroundings â capacities improve_ they will be able to actively develop their own communities and living conditions. The improvements in their lives will encourage others to take initiative as well.
iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: High Schools Development Programme in Savannakhet Province. The High School Development Programme aims to improve learning conditions in five high schools in three districts in Savannakhet Province. The quality of education in Lao high schools is very low and the schools lack resources. To improve the situation this programme was started in one pilot high school in Savannakhet. The results were excellent and the programme has now expanded to four new schools. Fidaâs partners in the programme are the locally registered Assemblies of God (AOG) NGO and the Ministry of Education. The programme concentrates on teacher training and providing textbooks and other materials to schools. In addition_ parents and teachers will be activated towards renovating some of the school buildings themselves. As the school environment and teacherâs skills improve_ the overall quality of education will also become better. Moreover_ through participation in renovation projects the parents and teachers will become more committed to educating their children and improving the schools further.

location.name: three Districts of the Savannakhet Province

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Community Health Education Programme in Northern Laos. The purpose of the programme is to establish functioning Community Health Education (CHE) programmes in 12â15 villages in three Northern Laos districts. In 2003 the Lao government compiled a list of the countryâs 47 poorest districts in need of development. Based on this list as well as the areaâs significance as the former royal capital_ three districts from Luang Prabang Province were chosen for this programme. In the CHE programme Fida partners with the Assemblies of God (AOG) NGO of Lao PDR. The programme will provide the village communities with holistic training in basic areas of life such as the health_ agriculture_ environment and marketing skills. Several model families will be trained in each village to set up an example for the others through the application of new methods and practices. The work is based on empowering the villagers to take care of themselves. Through the programme the villagers are equipped with useful skills and know-how that will help them to actively improve their own living conditions and overall quality of life in a sustainable way.
iati-activity.sector: Multisector aid for basic social services

iati-activity.title: International Law Capacity Building Program
iati-activity.description: Finland has supported the Laos PDR Ministry for Foreign Affairs led International Law Programme since 2001 with UNDP and the European Commission. Now Phase III of the Programme is beginnin gwith an objective to increase national capacity related to different aspects of the international law. The proposed project is in line with the Finnish development policy goals. It is important to also develop good governance and judicial system together with the economic development. The proposed project has a duration of 4 years. The total budget for 2009-2012 is 1_8 million euros.

iati-activity.title: Lao PDR Renewable Energy; Strategy Development and Capacity Building
iati-activity.description: The project supports the Lao PDR in the renewable energy strategy work encouraging more wide and efficient use of renewable energy as well as energy efficiency and energy savings in Laos PDR. The project enhances Laos capacity to implement the strategy and to manage the development of renewable energy_ and supports the mitigatation of the climate change.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Plan Finland)
iati-activity.description: Improved Primary Education. To contribute to the long-term goal of all children receiving good quality basic education and achieving mastery of essential learning competencies. To increase the net enrolment rates of primary school children_ especially girls and those from ethnic minorities and children with disabilities

iati-activity.description: Quest College_ Art & Media Department. The purpose of the project is to provide a leadership training among leaders responsible for educating and caring for the children in our partner_s schools

iati-activity.title: ICI Project for Forest Rehabilitation in Laos
iati-activity.description: The Viikki Tropical Resources Institute (VITRI) together with the National University of Laos (NUOL) proposes a project on forest rehabilitation in the Mekong River Basin. The purpose of the project is to strengthen the capacity of NUOL to educate forest professionals who in turn could promote sustainable use and good governance of forests in Laos. the project also aims at strengthening collaboraton between the regional institutes and professionals with the overall goal of redusing forest degradation and promoting forest rehabilitation. The project is in line with otehr Finnish development collaboration in the Mekong region. the proposed budget for one year is 169 973 euros.

iati-activity.title: Development of information management on minerals in Laos
iati-activity.description: The Ministry of Energy and Mines (MEM) of Lao PDR together with the Geological Survey of Finland is proposing an ICI project for capacity building of MEM's Department of Geology and Department of Mines. The overall objective of the project is to develop the mineral sector of in order to increase the economy of the country. This will be achieved through increasing capasities in MEM related to acquisition, management and distribution of information on minerals using the geoinformation system as a decision making tool and promotion of investments.

iati-activity.title: Mapping and Land Use
iati-activity.description: Making basic maps and developing spatial data information system and coordination between different ministries.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Strengthening Local Governance and Participation for the Reali
iati-activity.description: The overall objective: to support the development of primary education services to reach and respond to the specific needs of morginalized groups and remote communities in realizing their rights to education in Lao PDR.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening Environmental Management Lao PDR
iati-activity.description: The long term goal of the Project is to develop WREA and its provincial and district offices into a strong, authoritative and respected environmental management administration capable of ensuring good integration of environmental, social and economic dimensions, managing the environmental permitting system, setting and controlling fair and firm environmental requirements and responding effectively to environmental problems.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Laos
iati-activity.description: Environment Education actions which integrate a range of stimulating activities, built around local environment context, into school curriculum in remote vilages of Champasak Province (Southern Lao PDR), Awareness building to children and villagers, Knowledge transfer to primary and high school teachers, Sustainable development through laying groundwork for continued Environment Education
